description.whatIMade: Often, students using Assist.org struggle to find which colleges accept their specific courses for transfer credit. To solve this, I developed the Assist.org Reverse Search tool, a web application that allows users to input their completed courses and discover compatible colleges. Currently, this only exists as a python application, however I have plans to move this to a web application so it can be more user oriented. The app scrapes Assist.org data to match user courses with college requirements, providing a streamlined way for students to explore transfer options based on their academic history.
description.whatILearned: Whilst building this, I learned how to effectively use web scraping techniques to gather and process data from APIs. I also learned the ecosystem of Python app development, including setting up virtual environments, managing dependencies with pip, and structuring projects for scalability. Additionally, I gained experience in designing user-friendly interfaces and implementing efficient search algorithms to enhance the user experience. This project also improved my problem-solving skills as I navigated challenges related to data accuracy and application performance.

description.whatIMade: As part of a four-person team, I worked on a semester-long Java software engineering project to build a banking application. I helped draft the requirements document, designed UML class diagrams and use case documents to map software structure, and coordinated team tasks to ensure steady progress. I implemented the Server and Client objects and created a custom Request class to handle structured messages for banking operations like account creation, deposits, withdrawals, and transfers, enabling reliable communication between the client and server.
description.whatILearned: From this project, I learned the value of following a structured software engineering process, including requirements gathering, design, and documentation to guide development. Leading team coordination strengthened my communication and leadership skills, ensuring alignment and steady progress. I deepened my Java technical skills through implementing the server-client system and custom request handling, and gained experience in collaborative problem-solving by integrating team contributions into a cohesive application. Completing the project from start to finish also gave me practical insight into managing the full software development lifecycle.
